Component: Icons - Country Flags

Introduction

A list of all countries and their flags that are currently supported by the tesla.com application. If additional resources are needed, please contact Eric Ritchey.

Americas

tsla-flag-canada
tsla-flag-mexico
tsla-flag-united_states

Asias and Pacifics

tsla-flag-australia
tsla-flag-china
tsla-flag-japan
tsla-flag-hong_kong
tsla-flag-macau
tsla-flag-new_zealand
tsla-flag-south_korea
tsla-flag-taiwan

Europe

tsla-flag-austria
tsla-flag-belgium
tsla-flag-denmark
tsla-flag-european_union
tsla-flag-spain
tsla-flag-france
tsla-flag-finland
tsla-flag-germany
tsla-flag-ireland
tsla-flag-italy
tsla-flag-luxembourg
tsla-flag-netherlands
tsla-flag-norway
tsla-flag-sweden
tsla-flag-switzerland
tsla-flag-united_kingdom

Middle East

tsla-flag-jordan
tsla-flag-uae

Installation

NOTE: All flags are considered "extras" and are therefore not included in the base installation of Particles. This means that you have to explicitly include the CSS in the application. There are a few different ways to do this.

Option 1: Use kitchen-sink via Sass compile.
This file contains everything in Particles. It contains everything considered an "extra". As of v2.7.4, kitchen-sink.min.css is ~561kb (~194kb when gzipped). To use this approach, include in your application the following: 

  
  @import "[../]node_modules/@tesla/particles/scss/kitchen-sink";

Option 2: Use kitchen-sink via a link in your <head>. If you are not compiling via Sass, link up kitchen-sink via a link in the head of the application.

  
  <link href="[../]node_modules/@tesla/particles/css/kitchen-sink.min.css" rel="stylesheet">


Option 3: Sass Import.
If you are compiling via Sass in your local environment, you can add the following reference to your project's Sass file.

  
  @import "[../]node_modules/@tesla/particles/scss/_particles/extras/tsla-country_flags";


Option 4: Link up the generated CSS file. 

  
  <link href="[../]nodemodules/@tesla/particles/css/particles/extras/tsla-country_flags.css" rel="stylesheet">

Flags as Mixins

Each of the flags can also be used individually via mixins. Meaning, if there is already a DOM structure in place, updating that DOM structure might not be possible. As such, all flags have been made available as sass @mixins. Sample usage below:

NOTE: If you go this route, you'll either need to provide your own styling as laid out in _flags-base.scss, or import this file as well.

▲ 
<div class="example_flagsasmixins"></div>
▲ 
@import "[../]node_modules/@tesla/particles/scss/_particles/extras/country-flags/americas/flag-canada";

.example_flagsasmixins {
  @include flag-canada;
  width: 20px;
  height: 20px;
  background-size: 100%;
  background-repeat: no-repeat;
}
